title: Strava Privacy Policy
intro_text: Your privacy is very important to us. This visualization of our privacy policy explains the information we collect, how we use and share it, how to manage your privacy controls and your rights in connection with Strava’s websites and the related mobile applications and services (collectively, the “Services”). To view the full privacy policy, click here. To learn about how we protect information, click here. To learn about managing your settings, click here.

successor_links.text: Strava collects basic account information to help secure and provide you with access to our Services.
Strava collects activity information when you choose to upload content, join a challenge, add your equipment usage, view others’ activities, or otherwise use the Services.

You can choose to add your contacts’ information by connecting your contacts from your mobile device or social networking accounts to Strava. In accordance with your instructions, Strava may then access and store your contacts’ information in order to identify connections and help you connect with them.
Strava collects information from devices and apps you connect to Strava.
Strava may collect health information. Before you can upload health information to Strava, you must give your explicit consent to the processing of that health information by Strava.
Strava gathers information from content you share on the Services, including when you participate in partner events or create segments or routes.
When you make a payment on Strava, you may provide payment information to Strava.
When you make a payment on Strava, you may provide payment information to third parties.
Strava collects and processes location information when you sign up for and use the Services.

When you sign up and log in to the Services using accounts you create with third-party products and services, such as Facebook or Google (collectively, “Third-Party Accounts”), Strava may collect information provided to Strava under the Third-Party Account provider's privacy policies. You can generally control the information that we receive from these sources using the privacy controls in your Third-Party Account.
You can choose to provide us with your contact information so we can better respond to your support requests and comments.

Strava obtains additional third party information about our members from marketers, partners, researchers, and others. We may combine information that we collect from you with information obtained from other members, third parties and information derived from any other subscription, product, or service we provide. We may also collect information about you from other members such as when they give you kudos or comment on your activities.
Strava collects device information that provides us with technical information when you access or use the Services.
Strava uses log files to collect additional information.

nodes.label: You
nodes.text: This circle represents you. All the other circles represent data that we collect about you.

successor_links.text: Strava may aggregate the information you and others make available in connection with the Services and post it publicly or share it with third parties. To do this, we remove certain account information, such as your name, and combine the resulting information with similar information from other Strava athletes.
Strava may share your information with third parties who provide services to Strava.

When you choose to use third party apps, plugins, or websites that integrate with the Services, or when you use Strava features that are offered in conjunction with third parties such as a sponsored challenge, they may receive your information and content.
As a social network, Strava shares your information with other Strava members and the public in accordance with your privacy controls.

We may share your information with affiliates under common control with us, who are required to comply with the terms of this Privacy Policy with regard to your information. If Strava becomes involved in a business combination, securities offering, bankruptcy, reorganization, dissolution or other similar transaction, we may share or transfer your information in connection with such transaction.
We may preserve and share your information with third parties for legal requirements.
We may share your information with third parties when we forward Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) notifications, which will be forwarded as submitted to us without any deletions.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.text: All of your data that Strava collects. This is made up of many different kinds of data, which are shown in other circles in the diagram that have arrows pointing to this circle.

successor_links.text: Strava may use, sell, license, and share aggregated information with third parties for research, business or other purposes such as to improve walking, running or riding in cities via Strava Metro or to help our partners understand more about athletes, including the people who use their products and services.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects, Aggregated
nodes.text: Your information, name removed and aggregated with others' information. Examples include information about equipment, usage, demographics, routes and performance.

nodes.options_text: Please visit your privacy controls if you object to Strava sharing this information.
nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects, Aggregated
nodes.text: Your information, name removed and aggregated with others' information. Examples include information about equipment, usage, demographics, routes and performance.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.text: Information necessary to provide services to Strava such as supporting and improving the Services, promoting the Services, processing payments, or fulfilling orders. Service providers will only have access to the information necessary to perform these limited functions on our behalf and are required to protect and secure your information.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.data_handler: Third party apps, plugins, or websites
nodes.text: Information and content, including your photos and your activity data (including private activities).

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.text: Your information and content.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.data_handler: Affiliates under common control with Strava

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.data_handler: Third parties, including law enforcement, public or governmental agencies, or private litigants, within or outside your country of residence,
nodes.text: Your information, if we determine disclosure is allowed by the law or reasonably necessary to comply with the law, or if disclosure is reasonably necessary or appropriate to prevent any person from death or serious bodily injury, to address issues of national security or other issues of public importance, to prevent or detect violations of our Terms of Service or fraud or abuse of Strava or its members, or to protect our operations or our property or other legal rights.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.text: Your information, when we forward Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) notifications.

successor_links.text: Subject to your privacy controls, your username will be shared on Strava so that you may be able to participate in the Services, for example to show your place on a leaderboard.

nodes.label: Basic Account Information
nodes.text: Name, email address, date of birth, gender, username and password.

successor_links.text: Subject to your privacy controls, your profile and activities will be shared on Strava so that you may be able to participate in the Services, for example to show your place on a leaderboard.
Strava may make certain profile information available to non-members on the web.

nodes.label: Profile, Activity and Use Information
nodes.text: Pictures, activities (including date, time and geo-location information as well as your speed and pace) and posts, and other information about your use of the Services.

nodes.label: Public Profile
nodes.text: Name and some profile information.

nodes.options_text: Learn more about how we collect information about your contacts, how we use that information, and the controls available to you.
nodes.label: Your Contacts’ Information
nodes.text: Information about your contacts on your mobile device or social networking accounts.

successor_links.text: Subject to your privacy controls, the devices you use will be shared on Strava so that you may be able to participate in the Services, for example to show your place on a leaderboard.

nodes.label: Connected Devices and Apps
nodes.text: Information from devices and apps you connect to Strava. For example, you may connect your Garmin watch or Flywheel account to Strava and information from these devices and apps will be passed along to Strava.

successor_links.text: Certain health information may be inferred from various indicators.

nodes.options_text: Before you can upload health information to Strava, you must give your explicit consent to the processing of that health information by Strava. You can withdraw your consent to Strava processing your health information at any time.
nodes.label: Health Information
nodes.text: Health information from sources such as heart rate, power, cadence, height and weight and other indicators.

nodes.options_text: You can withdraw your consent to Strava processing your health information at any time.
nodes.label: Inferred Health Information
nodes.text: Health information inferred from other data.

successor_links.text: Subject to your privacy controls, the kudos and comments you give and receive will be shared on Strava so that you may be able to participate in the Services, for example to show your place on a leaderboard.

nodes.label: Content You Share
nodes.text: Photos, posts, comments, kudos and other content you share on the Services.

nodes.label: Kudos and Comments
nodes.text: Kudos and comments you give and receive.

nodes.label: Payment Information
nodes.text: Payment card and other payment details. We do not store your credit card information.

nodes.label: Payment Information
nodes.data_handler: Payment Card Industry compliant third-party payment services
nodes.text: Payment card and other payment details.

successor_links.text: Strava may share your precise location information on Strava with non-members, in accordance with your privacy controls.

nodes.options_text: You can tell us about important locations, such as your home or work address, by enabling a Privacy Zone in your settings. We will make private any portion of your activity that starts or ends in your Privacy Zone.
nodes.label: Location Information
nodes.text: Physical location of your device including, data such as speed and direction. Processing of your location data is essential to the Services which we provide and a necessary part of our performance of the agreement we have with you.

nodes.options_text: You can control this sharing in your privacy controls.
nodes.label: Location Information
nodes.text: Precise location information, such as a route or segment.

nodes.label: Third-Party Account Information
nodes.text: Information that you have agreed to make available such as your name, email address, profile information and preferences with the applicable Third-Party Account.

nodes.label: Information from Others
nodes.text: Information about you from third parties and other members.

nodes.label: Device Information
nodes.text: Information from your browser, computer, or mobile device, including device and network information, cookies, log files and analytics information.

nodes.label: Data from Log Files
nodes.text: IP addresses, browser type, internet service provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, platform type, date/time stamp, and number of clicks.

link_types.label: Include as Part of All Data Collected
Other
link_types.description: Change or share in some other way

use_types.description: Do anything that this policy allows Strava to do with all data it collects. Follow the arrow depicted for more.
Detect and prevent violations of the terms of service
Do anything that this privacy policy allows Strava to do
Allow you to participate in sweepstakes, contests, and other promotions
Conduct research and development on services
Conduct research not related to services
Not limited by this privacy policy
